prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part of the CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions of the object are approximately 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1.5 units in height. It is centered on a white background. *Step 1: Create a 2D sketch* Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.375, 0.0). This will position the sketch at the correct location for extrusion. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face\\_1) which is a rectangle. The rectangle is composed of six lines. - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.125) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.125), End Point (0.375, 0.125) - Line 4: Start Point (0.375, 0.125), End Point (0.375, 0.25) - Line 5: Start Point (0.375, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) - Line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.0) *Step 2: Scale the 2D sketch* Use the sketch\\_scale parameter to scale the sketch down to 75% of the original size. This will make the final prism object dimensions (3 x 2 x 1.5). *Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch* Perform the extrusion operation with extrusion\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal set to 0.375 units and extrusion\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal set to 0 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. *Step 4: Determine final shape dimensions* The dimensions of the prism are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.375 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
